There is evidence to suggest that parental involvement and mediation can reduce sibling rivalry in families with multiple children of the same gender. One effective strategy is for parents to encourage their children to talk openly and honestly about their feelings and concerns. This can help to defuse tensions and facilitate better communication between siblings. Parents can also promote positive interactions and teamwork by providing opportunities for their children to engage in joint activities and projects.

Additionally, parents can help to prevent sibling rivalry by treating their children equally, refraining from favoritism, and avoiding comparisons between siblings. They can also work to establish clear family rules and consequences for negative behaviors, and help their children learn conflict resolution skills.

While there are no guarantees that parental involvement and mediation will completely eliminate sibling rivalry in families with multiple children of the same gender, research suggests that these strategies can help to reduce it and create a more harmonious family environment.
